com.golden.gamedev.object.collision
Class PreciseCollisionGroup

java.lang.Object
  com.golden.gamedev.object.CollisionManager
      com.golden.gamedev.object.collision.BasicCollisionGroup
          com.golden.gamedev.object.collision.CollisionGroup
              com.golden.gamedev.object.collision.PreciseCollisionGroup
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdvanceCollisionGroup
public abstract class PreciseCollisionGroup
extends CollisionGroup

Subclass of CollisionGroup that calculates the precise positions of the Sprites at the moment of collision. It is suitable for collisions that need the colliding objects to stop rather than vanish.

For example:

  • Collisions between balls that need to stop or bounce precisely off each other.
  • An object falling to the ground and stopping.
  • Objects that are replaced by something else (such as an explosion effect).
    • &

This class may not work as expected with concave sprites- such as L-shapes. The position of the collision will be found accurately, but the direction may not be as anticipated as it is based on the CollisionRects rather than pixel collisions or custom CollisionShapes defined in subclasses of PreciseCollisionGroup If concave sprites are necessary, it might be advisable to break them into groups of smaller convex Sprites.

See Also:
PlayField.addCollisionGroup(SpriteGroup, SpriteGroup, CollisionManager)

Field Detail

ITERATIVE_BAILOUT

protected static double ITERATIVE_BAILOUT
This is used to test for non-convergence in pixel perfect collision, or when unusual CollisionShapes are used. The default value is 0.000001.

ADJACENCY_TOLERANCE

protected static double ADJACENCY_TOLERANCE
This is the distance that two objects must be within to be considered adjacent. When a collision occurs, the s at their reverted positions are guaranteed to be at least this close. This should be larger than ITERATIVE_BAILOUT. The default value is 0.0001.

log

protected boolean log
When set true, this PreciseCollisionGroup will send debugging information to the console.

Method Detail

isCollide

public boolean isCollide(Sprite s1,
                         Sprite s2,
                         CollisionShape shape1,
                         CollisionShape shape2)
Performs collision check between Sprite s1 and Sprite s2, and returns true if the sprites (shape1, shape2) collided.

The revert positions are set precisely by this method.

Overrides:
isCollide in class CollisionGroup
Parameters:
s1 - sprite from group 1
s2 - sprite from group 2
shape1 - bounding box of sprite 1
shape2 - bounding box of sprite 2
Returns:
true if the sprites is collided one another.
See Also:
CollisionGroup.collisionSide, CollisionGroup.sprite1, CollisionGroup.collisionX1, CollisionGroup.collisionY1, CollisionGroup.revertPosition1()
